themes: Cultural relevance and accessibility of training for immigrant artists
Volunteer-driven arts organizations and funding challenges
Support for organizations that provide resources to others
key_phrases: lack of understanding of the cultural context of these artists
provide training in Spanish (or other Asian languages)
with a cultural specialist that understands the cultural disconnect
application questions should relate to the quality of the art, the audience size and experience, and the quality of the administration
demographics of the staff and board does not equate with an inclusive approach
arts organizations are largely volunteer-driven because of the economic shifts in funding
consideration should be given to those organizations that provide opportunities, support or space to other arts organizations
barriers_identified: trainings have not translated well because of a lack of understanding of the cultural context
immigrant artists struggling to understand the application and non-profit system
application questions focused on staff/board demographics rather than programming
economic shifts leading to reliance on volunteers
solutions_proposed: provide training in Spanish (or other Asian languages) with a cultural specialist
revise application questions to focus on quality of art, audience experience, and administration
draw application questions sensitively to reflect volunteer-driven organizations
give consideration to organizations that provide opportunities, support, or space to other arts organizations
